intro: Cucumis tubiflorus, commonly known as the horned melon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, melons, and squashes. The plant produces large, spiky, green fruits that turn orange when ripe. The flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female blooms on the same plant. Its botanical features include trailing vines, heart-shaped leaves, and a distinctive, bumpy fruit surface.
